thread.title: Pepper IPO cornerstoned at lower multiple: sources
thread.title_full: Pepper IPO cornerstoned at lower multiple: sources | afr.com

author: afr.com
title: Pepper IPO cornerstoned at lower multiple: sources
text:
Pepper Group co-chiefs Patrick Tuttle and Mike Culhane together own about 40 per cent of the non-bank lender. Sasha Woolley by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Jake Mitchell Pepper Group's initial public offering has been cornerstoned with commitments from a dozen offshore and domestic investors, sources said.
It's understood the deal has been underwritten at a multiple of 10 times calendar year 2015 net profit after tax, which equates to a price of $2.60, down from 12 times.
The deal came after Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras agreed to a list of reforms in exchange for a bailout package . The resolution presented Pepper with a more stable backdrop when asking funds for commitments for a $145 million raising.
It means the float is covered and a bookbuild will not be required. A prospectus is expected to be lodged by the end of the week.
Pepper's management and founders are not selling into the float and will account for around 45 per cent of the register after the listing.
The multiple was cut to 10 times profit in a bid to garner strong support in the secondary market.
Pepper, founded about 15 years ago, has forecast revenue growth of 31 per cent to $304 million for calendar year 2015, and net profit growth of 34 per cent to $47 million.
Goldman Sachs and Macquarie Capital were the joint lead managers on the IPO, while Highbury Partnership was the company's financial adviser.
